one_reviews_text: Had this as a tip from a friend, and wow what a tip. Super cool this is what VR should be about.

review_title: Takes Comics to a whole new level
one_reviews_text: Enjoyed this immensely.  Incredible graphics, great quality and a really cool concept.  Can't wait for the second issue!
review_feedback: Yeah!  Thankyou for the review

one_reviews_text: The best comics are hand sculpted.
review_feedback: Yay!

one_reviews_text: just wondering i played this like a year or so ago
review_feedback: Working on it!

one_reviews_text: I loved the experience and Im really hoping for more.
review_feedback: on it!

one_reviews_text:
Very cool! keep making these! I'll buy them.

This is the best interactive VR graphic novel I've seen so far. 
 I'd add voice over narration to the speech bubbles and a small animation to show which bubble is being narrated. Add some more motion graphics and sound effects. As far as the interactive parts like the tree 'scene' for example. Add some colliders to the objects, like the tree and the lanterns. As far as the Story and the artwork. It's a pretty good story for a first issue but we don't have any context for the characters. I like the artwork of the graphic novel itself. The flow of the panels is easy to follow. Great job! I'm excited for the next issue!
review_feedback: Dude.  Thanks!  Great ideas, I think you'll like issue two. It's always a toss up with these on how to apply the fast-vs-fidelity brush.  Feels like there's a sweet spot we're spiraling in on.

one_reviews_text:
Just as short as regular bi-mensual comic book with about 15 pages this first introductive episode sets you up in an underground steampunk world very similar to The Matrix in a lot of ways. The book is magical so you can litteraly plunge your head into the book to spectate from very close the scene you are reading. You are never actor, you have no influence on the story. For example yo can dwelve into a scene and have a mini game allowing you to participate to the action as a spectator, trying to find out something that the main character cannot. It empowers the reader in a totally new way and it is consequent on your story's experience.

I appreciate that Nanite Fulcrum will is to be first and foremost a story at its core. The only problem I have is that I do not see any news of the next episode coming anytime soon or being worked at so this might be just a VR showcase product. The price is pinpoint for what is I hope now the first episode of a serie to come. If you are nearly interested in picture novels or comics this totally worth a try out.

Wow! Very cool. Graphics are great. The story has grabbed me. Enough substance to satsfy you, but so tasty that you hunger for more.  The immersive sections had me instantly wanting to learn more about this universe.  I love amazing backgrounds, so I had to check out their website, and Elvis Perry, you set the stage. Thank you and I can't wait for the next issue.

I was curious to see what a VR graphic novel experience could be like, and was blown away by how immersive the experience was.   First off, you don't lose the feeling of holding a book and turning pages.  And as a bonus, there are panels that you can literally pull yourself into and hang out in that moment for as long as you like.

There are a good handful of short films to experience in VR, but here is finally a new way of absorbing a story that lends itself well to this medium.  With all the hidden objects to collect, and hidden mini game, you'll find it's more than just a graphic novel, but an entire world to discover and explore.  Personally, I can't wait for Issue #2!
review_feedback: Thanks for the Review!

one_reviews_text:
This is no game! This is a visual novel / VR Comic. Many negative reviews are about how they dont know how to play that.... well I tell u: u dont!

Its a virtual comic book where u read and turn pages. The design is just awesome and it has many gimmicks. You can "travel" into some of the scenes and look at them in a real 3d environment. Also u have a mini game at the end of the comic. 

This is just one chapter of a hopefully huge story that will release later on. Think of it as a demo version. But already the demo is great. 

And well for all that say there is no tutorial and u dont know how to go on. Thats just not true, everything is explained in a great way.

I played that while sitting. No need to stand here. Just relaxe and read the story.

Only 4 stars, cause its to short^^ very short. Its so awesome... and then it ends.
Really shows the potential of comics in this new medium!  Although it is short, it does a great job of showing what vr can add to a story.   Highly recommend checking it out!

review_title: Lots of cool graphics, but not much more
one_reviews_text:
The idea is that this is a VR comic that you can read by turning the pages in VR.
There is bonus content that you can unlock that is supposed to make the experience more interactive.
The problem is, there is zero character development; the storyline is just an excuse to show off the very cool artwork; and the mini games are implemented horribly. The mechanics barely work the way they're supposed to. And the games don't bother saving your progress. So whatever you might unlock sort of just goes away. Not all at once either. Each time you're sent to the "trophy" screen, some of what you unlocked is gone.
It seems they're trying to sell 3D printed versions of the in-game statues you can unlock, for about $150.
Maybe that's the point of all this? 
Otherwise, it's just a bunch of random, unconnected pieces that look very cool in VR.

review_title: Looking forward to the next release
one_reviews_text: Highly recommed checking this out, reading comics has never been more immersive.

As a 46 year old former comic book collector I was intrigued by this program.  It took a couple of days before I became bored enough to check it out, and I'm glad I did.  First the story and writing isn't my cup of tea or style but the graphics were incredible!  This IS where the next step of comic books can go.  I gave up on comics because as the value (story, art, the hobby of collecting, etc) went down, the price of a book went up.  It just wan't fun or interesting for me any longer, but this is.  It's immersive, the story needs work but the bones are there, and I can even see an angle on collecting if done right.  Therefore I'd be willing to spend -- IN THE FUTURE --  up to $5 an issue, maybe more if you can give me a reason it's worth it.  Of course the story and writing has to (Humble Opinion) improve at the very least.  But the concept and the art is ready to go.  

(Update:  I'd like to make one suggestion.  Perhaps this format would work more on a anthology level [think "Heavy Metal"] than a traditional single character driven storyline.  In my opinion I think you would have a real viable business venture to move forward with.)
review_feedback: We couldn't agree more.  Thanks for the review.

one_reviews_text:
This really is the future of comic books. 

I really enjoyed this experience, reading the comic and being able to "enter" certain panels is really cool and I like the unlockable aspect (even if I do always miss the first one with that phone throw)

If you release more I'm going to be more than happy to pay for the content :)

Well done!

That word might be overused but in this case it's definitely not!  Honored to be one of the first to experience a 3D Graphic Novel in VR. The narrative experience is amazing - allowing me to go inside the panels of the comic - and the format has so many possibilities for storytelling that it's mind boggling. Loved the bullet mini game at the end.  My high score was 557! The ad for Jigsaw was super cool as well.
Really enjoyed episode 1, when is more coming?

Neat concept that would be amazing for Marvel or DC to adopt, but as far as this "comic" itself, it was very short, the story was uninteresting, and the art design is honestly terrible with ugly characters that push me even farther away from any sort of connection with them. Also, the stupid ball-toss mechanic to unlock stuff seemed entirely out of place. Again, great concept, but kinda terrible in the execution.
review_feedback: Thanks for the review.   btw, if you never hit a crystal you can unlock the figurines just by visiting a panel.  Also, there's a minigame on the last page you might have missed.

one_reviews_text:
You, in a room, holding/reading a 2D Book.
& Thats it.
Theres supposed to be a way to `step into` certain blue bordered panels but no actual directions on how to do that. I Lost interest and closed   it very quickly. (Which I had to do by killing the process in file manager, as there are no instructions on how to do that either). The program was stable enough and the lobby room looked ok, but this really does need idiot proof instructions for old duffers like me as I just couldn`t get into the main part of the program, (which is why I ditched it). 
p.s. please don`t use the phrase "knock your socks off" in any reply, it makes me cringe...
review_feedback:
Sorry to hear about your experience. Sounds Frustrating.  It also sounds like you had some trouble accessing the main Oculus menu and exiting the application?

FYI if you hit the oculus button on your touch controllers, there is a "exit to home" button on the bottom left of the main oculus menu that you can use at any time, in any application.

If by chance you feel like giving us a try again and are ready to exit, look to your left and you will see a large red EXIT sign, just like in a movie theater.  Fix your gaze on this sign and the app will exit once the countdown dial completes.    

Also, it sounds like you had some trouble flipping the pages and did not find the bonus panel hint on page 5.   After you use the A and X buttons to flip pages (there are hints that appear on your hands to guide you) there is a rather large hint that tells you how to enter the panels with the blue borders (it actually stops you from proceeding until you do).  We've also noticed that some newcomers who have not gone through the standard Oculus touch controller tutorials have a difficult time using the grip buttons and can get frustrated when trying to grab an object in VR for the first time (like the book)

Regardless, welcome to VR and feel free to email us at bugs@spiraloid.net and we'll try to get your sorted.  We want you to have a good experience.  Socks or not.

review_title: Received for Free, Glad I Didn't Pay
one_reviews_text: The game is basically you standing in a room, holding a graphic novel in front of you. You turn the pages by pressing a button and there's only like 3 or 4 panels on a spread. Occaisonally you get a special panel where you can enter the world and look at a 3D model or part of the environment. When I read the description, it sounded way cooler than what it actually is. Not a fan of the comic either, which is half the game. Its about the experience in VR but honestly there isn't much here. Pass.
review_feedback:
Thanks for the review.  Here's a video of the minigame you missed.
https://youtu.be/7DRZbUrH84Q

one_reviews_text:
Relatively good graphics (kudos to whoever did the models). Ability to resize the comic was nice touch. Good idea overall.
Currently Free – which is a good thing otherwise reviews would be abysmal in its current status. Relatively interesting but ultimately boring mini-game. Advertisement for a movie present. Comic (it is the main element of the experience) is somewhat out of context and not too convincing (the “scientific” vocabulary was cringing) and tried to deliver too much in such a short amount of frames).
Unintuitive controls; No ability to teleport during most of the experience (the scene with the grass and the dog in particular would have been perfect for that). Bugs such as two sets of hands in some of the interactive panels - the first unlockable not seeming to trigger anything (frustrating in particular as the cell phone that you need to throw doesn’t respawn and is hard to target and only seem to respawn after going to other panels).
Separate comment on the Jigsaw experience - whoever approved this or did the QA feeling the experience was satisfactory should be fired -or put on one of these chairs while at it… ;).
review_feedback: Thanks for the review.

review_title: A great idea, but poorly implemented
one_reviews_text: Wasn't sure what this would be like, but once you have a go you realise that 3D VR comics is an inspired idea that could be brilliant if done well. Unfortunately this isn't a great first attempt with a slightly broken, unintiative interface and v. short and not particularly great bit of a story. If someone like Marvel, DC or 2000AD invested money and talent into this concept then it could be wonderful though!
review_feedback: Thanks for the review.

one_reviews_text: it took me a while to understand that in fact was a normal comic with the blue boxes... nothing special there i wanted some action or be able to interact with somethig for a normal comic i think a normal comic is better
review_feedback: Thanks for the Review.  You might want to checkout the achievements. There are few things you may have missed.  ;)

one_reviews_text: Hard to believe I first experienced this nearly a year ago--the recent update prompted me to check it out again. Glad I did--I appreciate it all the more the second time around. Nice combination of virtual comic and virtual reality environments!
review_feedback: Thanks, glad you dug the improvements!

review_title: nice idea but limited appeal in VR
one_reviews_text: great ideas about stepping into a 2D comic in VR but we need a reason to be there, or the dramatic effect is lost. i had no investment in the boring story even though the visuals were great
review_feedback: Thanks for the review.  Glad you like the visuals,  we'll try to punch up the story next time.

one_reviews_text: I really like the direction VR is heading with graphic novels. This is the first one I know and I really like it. Looking forward to more of this.
review_feedback: Dude! Thanks!

one_reviews_text: Keep running into issues where the camera is stuck in one direction and reversed compared to where I am looking. Multiple times the game hits a showstopper and I cannot proceed forward. I think Im 3 minutes into the game.... that's as far as I can make it without hitting a deadend bug.
review_feedback: Should all be fixed in the latest update!

one_reviews_text: Forget the story. This is all about the visual experience and the artwork. Very impressive.
review_feedback: Thanks!

one_reviews_text: It's a comics, you enter some pictures and nothing else...not fun at all...graphics are correct
review_feedback: Thanks for the review.  Sounds like you missed a few things.  checkout the achievements.

one_reviews_text: Nice and short VR experience of a comic book that comes to life. Unlike so many other of these early releases, this one exhibits something interesting: entering a comic book. It reminded me of the WoW Warlords of Draenor release teasers. Looking forward to the 2nd issue!
review_feedback: Thanks! On it!

review_title: I dont read comic books but I rfead this
one_reviews_text: Best comic book experience when could ask for, as you read objects and figures apear from the story to help you get a better sense of how these people or things look. You can even play games in portions of the book to get the best grasp of their situations...just download you will enjoy it lol
review_feedback: Thanks so much for the great review and 5 stars.  Feels good man.

one_reviews_text:
It was cool. Very different. 
Interesting way to market a movie too. 10/10 for originality.
review_feedback: Sweet!  Thanks man!

one_reviews_text: little to no help in figuring what to do...
review_feedback: Aww, sorry you got stuck.  send us a mail at bugs@spiraloid.net and we can try to help you through.  Some hints that might help.  grab the VR headset that appears floating in front of you by gripping with your touch controllers grip button.  put it on your face.  this will teleport you backstage where you will find a magic book on a strange desk.  look at your hands to learn what to do next.  ;)

one_reviews_text: I loved every minute of it! Please continue!
review_feedback: Will do!

one_reviews_text: I really like the concept of VR Comics.
review_feedback: Thumbs up Zork32.  Avoid the bear.

review_title: One of the Best VR expereinces
one_reviews_text: There is nothing to hate about this game it is fun and intersting. A reader, magical, game, comic, adventure and a little of mystery. This has it all, the collectibles to gather from each interactive magical book page. The story captures your attention leaving you wanting more. The amazing fun bonus/mini game inside. A must try for everybody.
review_feedback: Monsieur,   You are the best.  Thanks.

review_title: not as fun as i thought it was
one_reviews_text: when you start you put a vr gogles on youre head then spawn where theres are places to place colectibles one mini game not that fun really short but it is just early acess and i did receive it for free but do not buy it till its fully done unless you want to play 4 minutes of this games
review_feedback: We'll try to get you cheering next time. Thanks for the review!  Btw, we're adding some achievements that you give you some clues to help find the things you may have missed!

review_title: What is there not to like? EVERYTHING!
one_reviews_text: Wait no, there's everything to like, I mean :D Thanks for sharing this as early access! This was an awesome experience, even though it was short, it didn't left me feeling short of an experience. The only thing that caused me little trouble is the bug, when you take off the HMD and it goes into standby, the app seems to get stuck sometimes or crashes. So I had to re-start it 3 times before I played the minigame. But giving 5 stars regardless, because seeing also the dev feedback here, I'm sure it will get fixed! Amazing minigame btw, that's the way to experience a truely immersive comics book! The world needs more creative heads like the ones working on this! Can't wait for it's next issues (please don't make it too short of issues haha).
review_feedback: Hey thanks for the review!   Can you email us your machine specs and any other info regarding that crash to bugs@spiraloid.net and we'll get it sorted!

one_reviews_text:
This is what VR is all about.  First-person shooters, physics games, etc. are pretty much expected.  But it's rare to see something that not only uses the medium in an unconventional way, but actually produces what might amount to a whole new meta-media style unto itself.  Interactive comic books.  I'm on board.
One caveat: The bonus panel minigames (toss an object at the blue floaty thing) the throwing seems to be off.  I will throw in what I percieve to be a straight line, such as literally thrusting my fist out straight and releasing the grip, and the ball invariably travels on an upward angle of about 20 degrees.  So I have to correct by aiming below the object, which can be rather frustrating.  But it doesn't detract from the overall experience, since no one is forcing me to hit them all.
review_feedback: thanks for the review!  Yeah the toss mechanic can be really tricky.  We're on it. Great feedback!

one_reviews_text: Blend of VR comic book, environments, and minigame. Easily worth paying for, but it's free! Beautiful artwork and fun things to interact with. The comic book has motion pictures where if you angle the book a certain way, the image changes. Then you can put the comic book up to your face to enter bonus scenes, which are well-crafted VR environments. The bonus scene with the tree and the moving grass is breath-taking. There's another bonus scene with the main character and I love the little touch of being able to interact with glowing orbs. I played with those for a bit too long. The minigame has you bouncing from bullet to bullet so they join the vortex, allowing you to keep score. I really like how it takes a story and puts you at the center of a pivotal scene. Looking forward to future installments.
review_feedback:
It's reviews like this that make us all grin.  Thanks for taking the time to review our efforts man!   

If you want, signup for our spiraloid.net newsletter, we'll be sending word when the next issue's ready!

one_reviews_text: Really interesting model for a game world and storytelling. I did experience a few bugs such as not being able to remove myself from a page/room. But the rest of it works top notch.
review_feedback: Thanks for the feedback!  Could you email bugs@spiraloid.net which page/room you got stuck in?

one_reviews_text: SO cool! Those movements... oh... those lines, Great potential! BIG thank you! Great models i was enjoy just whatch them!
review_feedback: Thanks for the great Review, Glad you like it!

one_reviews_text: come on it's there's more to this book...
review_feedback: Heh, fair point.  fixed!

one_reviews_text: I give this a 5 not because it's perfect, but because I sincerely enjoyed the experience and was inspired by what this type of storytelling has the potential to be. The art in this is beautiful and the scenes are interesting. There were little mistakes here and there (spelling, minor bugs, etc) but nothing that severely impacted the experience. I definitely recommend you check it out, especially since it is free!
review_feedback: Thanks for the feedback!  I think I see my spelling mistake too!  ;) Artist thumbprints.  Glad you enjoyed the experience!  We're inspired about what can be done with a format like this to!

one_reviews_text: At the bigining you have to grab the book and pull picture with the blue border to your face! Spend some time to understand that. Art is awesome here! A lot of work.. story.. not sure, it's just ok. Game.. there is no game :)
review_feedback: Thanks for the review.  Did you miss the Bonus minigame at the end?  Current high score here is 617... ;)

review_title: Im sure there is a hidden gem here......
one_reviews_text: ...but this game has hidden promise Im sure but its too hidden for me. Didnt have a clue what to do. Instructions are weird...it just sat there with no direction of what to do next...found a hidden game but beyond that....worth a look though.
review_feedback: Thanks for this. Hmmm  it mysteriously sounds like we failed you a bit.  pondering...  ok, So we wanted it to be a comic and make sure you were the one setting the pace and discovering things you like without being rushed.   Hoping to the spark some curiosities and instead made it weird?  Maybe drop us a line and tell us what you like least/best? Anyway, thanks for your time and we shall try to make it more fun in Isssue Two!   Thankyou for the review!

one_reviews_text: Hope there will be more.
review_feedback: Thanks for the review.  Great to hear as we're working on Issue Two!  If you want, signup for our spiraloid.net newsletter, and we'll send word when the next issue's ready!

one_reviews_text:
this is an awesome idea for presenting stories using the medium. I was engaged as hell and I really can't wait for the next part.

the mini game was slightly difficult to understand what I was supposed to do in the beginning but I worked it out fairly quickly.

this really lends itself to experimental 360 - my rig is front facing only and there were a couple of times in the mini game that I lost tracking because I was shooting directly behind and had to look for another way.
review_feedback: Awesome! Thanks so much for this review!  Btw,  in the mingame you can turn by 15 degree increments with the thumbsticks, this makes it so you can "turn around" and still face your sensors (our high score is 617), Thanks for diving in!

one_reviews_text: The future of graphic novels looks stunning. This free book is a great way to get people hooked. Hopefully the devs keep future volumes at a fair price so that many will be able to enjoy it. The tree scene that you can step into is marvelous. This is a great concept that takes full advantage of what VR has to offer.

It looks realy good. The text is big, and easy to read. The artwork is CG. Not realy my thing but it looked fine. But the coolest part is the frames you can go inside gives you a closer look at spaces or 3d models. Tho in the end it is a book. As some one who reads a lot of manga, sadly the wrighting didn't grab me. Alot of it felt unnatural and lacking emotion.

It did lockup 3 times for me in a short amount of time. I'll try it again in about a week or so.

review_title: Decent ideas, needs a bit of work
one_reviews_text: Advertises controller support but actually requires Touch. "Pulling" yourself into the blue panels often doesn't work. And the bullet kinetic energy minigame is not all that interesting. The VR comic mix is intriguing though.
review_feedback: Oh man, you played the very first build.  Sorry about that, my bug.  I accidentally left the controller support checkbox on.  Yep touch only, although we're working on a controller only mode.   Thanks for the feedback!

one_reviews_text: Like the innovative idea, the immersion. I think it could be made into a great product. Few things to consider: immersive play needs to be more interactive. I was pretty disappointed when I realized that most 360 scenes are just static pictures. Ideally, the scenes can be played out, and the player can  control the events (doesn't matter 1st person or 3rd). I realize this may require a whole different level of cgi investment (e.g. for walking/interacting people), but it would really make the game light up.
review_feedback: Indeed.  We have updated a bit since you played it seems since after reading your comments we agreed that you were correct so we added little mini games in all the bonus artwork scenes.  Thanks for the feedback!

one_reviews_text: This showed that this type of experience can work. If I was to rate this on potential, I'd give this 5 stars. However, the story itself was blah at best. Thus the 3 stars. I do recommend watching this once. It's free. The interactive scenes are somewhat interesting. You won't want to look at this twice though until better content comes along.
review_feedback: Thanks for the Review!  Glad you see the potential.

one_reviews_text: This is really good. The graphics and the 3d engine are excellent. i also liked the story and the interactive parts. Can't wait to see what comes next. Definitely on the right tracks here. Recommended
review_feedback: Awesome! Thanks so much for this review!  We'll try to stay on those tracks! :D

one_reviews_text: This innovative take on storytelling leaves me dying for more.  Graphic novels will never be the same.

Very cool. It's a pretty engaging narrative experience, and the artwork is simply gorgeous. Not long or developed enough at this point to get really invested in the characters or story, but it has some serious potential.
review_feedback: Thanks for the feedback!  We think so too!

one_reviews_text: Really great way to experience VR. Looking forward to trying some more.
I look forward to more titles like this..I hope someone does some Judge Dredd graphic novels like this!
review_feedback: Thanks for the review!  Judge Dredd would rule like this.  And there are some wicked 3D models out there of him too.  Now if only a 3D artist and an indie game dev had a 20 page screenplay and we'd all be partying like it's 2000 AD.

one_reviews_text: Its a nice idea, a lot more work needs to go into the individual scenes, and the ability to move around within them would make this a great experience, 3/5.
review_feedback: Awesome! Thanks for the review!  Thanks for the ideas about moving around in the bonus artwork scenes.  In the latest update we actually added some minigames to all the bonus scenes because of feedback like yours.  Thanks!

one_reviews_text: Looking forward to next issue! This is a really cool new way to experience comics. Great idea!
Great art with an interesting story but what really makes it special is going into the panels and really being in the scene or playing the mini game. More please!
just a shoot em up ? or did i miss it ?
review_feedback: nah, you got it.  ;)

one_reviews_text: Useless instructions. Non-functional, pointless and a complete waste of time and money.
review_feedback:
We shall refund your $0.00 immediately then.  ;)  
Seriously, sorry you had a frustrating experience.  Sounds like we failed you.  We've actually updated the hints quite a bit since you played, so those who've come after you hopefully had a better go at it thanks to your feedback.  (early access right?)  anyway, thanks for the review.  We'll try to knock your socks off next time.  Cheers.

one_reviews_text: Worst vr I ever played. Once you are dragged into bonus material book it does not do anything.
review_feedback: Sorry to hear we frustrated you man.  Hope you find other VR cool stuff.   btw, if you ever play again. try throwing the VR headset at the Nanite Fulcrum logo.  We made it so you could shatter it.  Been thinking about making a little speaker hookup here at the spiraloid workshop so we have to hear it when someone hits it.  like a boo (or a cheer as people manage to find all the figurines...  ;) )

one_reviews_text: cool experience, for free definatly worth checking out.
Engaging and left me wanting to find out more about the swarm!  Come on issue 2!
review_feedback: Awesome! Thanks so much for this review! We're on it!

one_reviews_text: It's a really weird experience, not my cup of tea. And what annoyed me: being IN rocks with my feet, rocks flying through me. Strange game.
not worth the time
review_feedback: Thanks for the feedback, Sorry to hear we failed knocking your socks off.  Curious at what point you stopped playing or any other information you have that could help us improve.

one_reviews_text: Product will not install...
review_feedback: bummer.  That's probably on me at the beginning.  first time uploading my build to oculus.  Does the latest version install?  any errors?

one_reviews_text: wont download  at all.
review_feedback: Sorry to hear that.  We've updated a few times since this.  Any errors or were you able to sort it out?

one_reviews_text:
It's an intriguing opening for what I hope will be a killer series.  

The presentation is what really puts Nanite Fulcrum over the top.  You literally get to pull yourself into the panels of a comic and interact with the story in real time.  Add in some mini games, trophies, hidden panels and you've got a comic with unprecedented immersion.  

Definitely worth checking out!
review_feedback: Thanks for the feedback and the awesome review!  We felt a bit like we were putting on a show while building the theater and the seats at the same time.  Glad you like the presentation.  As creators we're stretching to really own as much of what you experience as we can, so it's super gratifying to hear you say that.  So Cheers!

review_title: A must see for fans of graphic novels!
one_reviews_text: As a long time fan of graphic novels, I found this experience simply stunning. Polished work and a smooth experience. An intriguing story and beautiful art work.  The future is looking good if you love comics.
